summary: Backend agent/skill wiring is mostly consistent, but one high-severity mandatory reference path issue and one medium traceability reference issue were found within the scoped specs.

findings.message: Partial review orchestration requires reading the latest SSOT commit from `../docs`, but that path is absent in this repository environment, creating a blocking wiring dependency for `/be-review-partial`.

evidence.snippet: Detect the latest SSOT submodule commit (expected at `../docs`).
Use Bash to read the latest SSOT submodule commit from `../docs` and validate the partial commit convention.
Directory does not exist relative to `/Users/kanggyeonggu/Documents/league-of-algologic`.

findings.proposed_fix: Make the docs location configurable (e.g., env var or skill input), validate existence before execution, and add a fallback prompt when unavailable. If `../docs` is truly mandatory, document/bootstrap that dependency so the path is always present.

findings.message: `AGENTS/CLAUDE/AGENTS/BACKEND/README.md` lists many agent files as bare filenames that do not exist relative to that directory, reducing SSOT traceability and causing ambiguous ownership navigation.
findings.proposed_fix: Replace bare filenames with explicit relative paths (e.g., `REVIEW/BE_REVIEW_MASTER_AGENT.md`, `DEV/BE_DEV_MASTER_AGENT.md`) and keep naming/path conventions consistent across all table entries.
